intro: Psychotria tsaratananensis var. tsaratananensis, commonly known as the Tsaratanana Psychotria, is a species native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often accompanied by a distinctive red calyx. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in montane rainforests. Due to its restricted habitat and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
